connector.description: Store and retrieve data from AWS DynamoDB service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.path.tableName.name: camel.sink.path.tableName
camel.sink.path.tableName.description: The name of the table currently worked with.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient.description: To use the AmazonDynamoDB as the client

camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead
camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.description: Determines whether or not strong consistency should be enforced when data is read.

camel.sink.endpoint.keyScalarType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyScalarType
camel.sink.endpoint.keyScalarType.description: The key scalar type, it can be S (String), N (Number) and B (Bytes)

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: What operation to perform One of: [BatchGetItems] [DeleteItem] [DeleteTable] [DescribeTable] [GetItem] [PutItem] [Query] [Scan] [UpdateItem] [UpdateTable]

camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDB client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: The region in which DynamoDB client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDB client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity
camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for reading resources from your table

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which DDB client needs to work

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity.name: camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity
camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

camel.component.aws2-ddb.amazonDDBClient.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.amazonDDBClient
camel.component.aws2-ddb.amazonDDBClient.description: To use the AmazonDynamoDB as the client

camel.component.aws2-ddb.consistentRead.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.consistentRead
camel.component.aws2-ddb.consistentRead.description: Determines whether or not strong consistency should be enforced when data is read.

camel.component.aws2-ddb.keyScalarType.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.keyScalarType
camel.component.aws2-ddb.keyScalarType.description: The key scalar type, it can be S (String), N (Number) and B (Bytes)

camel.component.aws2-ddb.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws2-ddb.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws2-ddb.operation.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.operation
camel.component.aws2-ddb.operation.description: What operation to perform One of: [BatchGetItems] [DeleteItem] [DeleteTable] [DescribeTable] [GetItem] [PutItem] [Query] [Scan] [UpdateItem] [UpdateTable]

camel.component.aws2-ddb.overrideEndpoin.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.overrideEndpoint
camel.component.aws2-ddb.overrideEndpoin.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDB client

camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyPort.description: The region in which DynamoDB client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDB client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-ddb.readCapacity.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.readCapacity
camel.component.aws2-ddb.readCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for reading resources from your table

camel.component.aws2-ddb.region.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.region
camel.component.aws2-ddb.region.description: The region in which DDB client needs to work

camel.component.aws2-ddb.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-ddb.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-ddb.uriEndpointOver.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.uriEndpointOverride
camel.component.aws2-ddb.uriEndpointOver.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.component.aws2-ddb.useDefaultCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-ddb.useDefaultCrede.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-ddb.writeCapacity.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.writeCapacity
camel.component.aws2-ddb.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

camel.component.aws2-ddb.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-ddb.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
